text: Kim Jong Un's reputation in the military
is that he is more of a dictator than
Kim il-sung and Kim jong-il among his
wrongdoing is his foreign policy but
worst is the way he is treating the
elite in North Korea he is using a reign
of terror and killing people harshly
it's got to the point where people are
feeling resistant to the regime his
father and grandfather dealt with crimes
in the military with demotion and soft
punishment but now it's execution he's
executed his close allies and their
children many of whom were my friends I
have witnessed a series of executions
people disappeared overnight friends who
I'd be talking to the day before their
whole family were sent to concentration
camps when it comes to the execution of
high-ranking officials in the past the
firing squad would use nine bullets but
since the reign of Kim jong-un it's 90
bullets and I've also seen them using
machine guns the chief military
officials who witnessed the killings
were crying and shaking
last August Kim jong-un ordered the wire
fence along the border with China to be
tightly entangled in diamond shapes so
the person's head cannot even go through
and this fence was electrified they've
also put ankle mines along the secret
paths and installed CCTV this border is
a lifeline for North Korean people and
many scratched a living by smuggling but
because Kim jong-un tightened the border
control we can't smuggle basics like
rice and oil Chinese goods are still
coming through customs but it is not
enough to meet demand
so it's tough there right now when I
speak to my brother on the phone he says
life has become very hard nothing is
produced by North Korea it depends on
China for everything from food to
everyday products I have seen a lot of
smugglers get arrested and sent to
prison people in North Korea often say
that smuggling starts from zero and ends
with zero if you get arrested and sent
to prison you end up with nothing the
most severe punishment is execution by
gunshot when you smuggle opium from
China other severe crimes include
damaging statues or portraits of the Kim
family dynasty that's a severe crime
punishable by death with gunshot
I went into the business of selling
mobile phones after I graduated from
university I didn't know what to do but
people were beginning to use mobile
phones and it was a huge boom somehow I
met a supplier and because I come from a
middle-income family I was able to start
the business and I began to sell to a
lot of people and to expand most North
Koreans run a business and that's a way
to survive the only way to survive
because when you go into a company to
work they don't pay you a salary there
are a few people who can make a living
from the money the state pays a high
ranking official makes money but for
anyone lower than that the wife has to
go out to the market to make ends meet
for the family there are many suffering
from lack of food but where I come from
I haven't seen people dying of hunger I
don't think people are suffering from
lack of food like they used to in the
90s another reason that people don't die
of hunger now is because North Koreans
have become more aware instead of
starving to death people scavenge for
food in the mountains or woods or plant
vegetables to sell but still a lot of
people are barely surviving even the
security services need money so when
they crack down on businesses you need
money to bribe them that's the only way
to get away with it
you
